SEARCH
Package ui

Class Main

java.lang.Object
ui.Main
public class Main extends Object
The Main class represents the main entry point of the application. It provides a command-line interface for interacting with the ReadXSystems library system.

  • Constructor Details

    • Main

      public Main()
      Constructs a new Main object. Initializes the Scanner for user input, the ReadXSystems controller, and the SimpleDateFormat for date formatting.

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      The main method is the entry point of the application. It creates an instance of the Main class and starts the menu loop.
      Parameters:
      args - Command line arguments

    • printMenu

      public void printMenu()
      Prints the main menu options to the console.

    • initTest

      public void initTest()
      This method initializes the test by printing the result of initializing the model in the controller.

    • generateReport

      public void generateReport()
      This method generates different reports based on user selection. It prompts the user to choose a report type and prints the corresponding report. The available report options are: -Report the total accumulated number of pages read on the entire platform. -Report the most read book genre and magazine category for the entire platform. -Report the Top 5 most read books and Top 5 most read magazines on the platform. -Report the number of books sold and total sales value, for each genre. -Report the number of active subscriptions and the total value paid for subscriptions.

    • readDate

      public Calendar readDate(String message)
      This method reads and validate a date typed by the user.
      Parameters:
      message - : String the message that will be displayed to the user to indicate what or where to write their response.
      Returns:
      : Calendar the input of the user.

    • validateOptionInputByRange

      public int validateOptionInputByRange(String message, int leftEndPoint, int rightEndPoint)
      Reads an integer value from the user input within a specified range.
      Parameters:
      message - The message to display to the user
      leftEndPoint - The minimum allowed value
      rightEndPoint - The maximum allowed value
      Returns:
      The validated integer value
